intro: Callicarpa lanceolaria, commonly known as the lanceleaf beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of vibrant purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits. Its berries are a food source for birds and other wildlife, contributing to local biodiversity. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and can reach heights of up to 6 feet.
